thread.title: HSS 2Night Week Seven Play of the Week
thread.title_full: HSS 2Night Week Seven Play of the Week

title: HSS 2Night Week Seven Play of the Week
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest HSS 2Night Week Seven Play of the Week Leo Haghighi of Lewis and Clark earns our Week 7 'Play of the Week' for his spectacular one-handed grab. Post to Facebook HSS 2Night Week Seven Play of the Week Leo Haghighi of Lewis and Clark earns our Week 7 'Play of the Week' for his spectacular one-handed grab.  //on.krem.com/1LFf6DP   HSS 2Night Week Seven Play of the Week Leo Haghighi of Lewis and Clark earns our Week 7 'Play of the Week' for his spectacular one-handed grab. Evan Closky, KREM2 Sports Reporter 10:59 p.m. PDT October 18, 2015 Leo Haghighi of Lewis and Clark makes an incredible one-handed catch at Joe Albi Stadium against University. The Tigers beat the Titans 24-21. (Photo: KREM2) CONNECT TWEET   
Playoff season is not too far away as week seven of the prep football season is in the books and our HSS 2Night 'Play of the Week' goes to Leo Haghighi of Lewis and Clark. 
The wide receiver catches a 40-yard pass from Jordan Summers with one hand . This was a huge grab because the Tigers would later score a touchdown on the drive. Lewis and Clark would beat University 24-21 in a great game at Joe Albi Stadium. 
We will be spotlighting a play every Sunday on KREM 2 News. Make sure to join Darnay Tripp and Evan Closky for HSS 2Night Friday nights on KREM 2 News at 11.  //on.krem.com/1LFf6DP TOP VIDEOS
